description: Implement a CSS custom properties-based theming system supporting 4 themes (A/B/C/D) x 2 modes (light/dark). Theme switching is done by swapping data attributes on the root element (data-theme='a|b|c|d' and data-mode='light|dark'). All visual theming (colors, borders, radius, shadows, fonts) must use CSS custom properties — minimize JS conditionals for styling, though conditional rendering logic (e.g. different icons or layout behavior) in JS is acceptable. All existing components must be refactored to use CSS custom properties instead of hardcoded colors/values. Variables must cover: backgrounds (--bg, --surface, --surface-hover), text (--text, --text-muted, --accent, --accent-text), borders (--border, --border-light, --border-w, --border-w-heavy), border radius (--radius-sm through --radius-2xl, --radius-pill), shadows (--card-shadow, --btn-shadow, --modal-shadow), selection UI (--sel-border, --sel-handle-fill, --sel-handle-stroke, --sel-handle-size, --sel-rotate-color, --sel-hover-fill, --sel-dash), patterns (--pattern-image, --pattern-size, --pattern-opacity), fonts (--font-body, --font-display), and overlay/selected states. Theme changes transition smoothly via CSS transition (~0.35s) on color, background, border, and shadow properties only (not fonts or pattern images, which swap instantly to avoid reflow jank). Font loading strategy: eagerly load the active theme's font(s); lazy-load other theme fonts on demand when the user switches themes.
steps_to_verify: Root element has data-theme and data-mode attributes
All 4 themes define the full set of CSS variables listed above
Each theme has both light and dark mode variant definitions
Switching themes changes all UI colors, borders, radii, shadows, and fonts simultaneously
Color/background/border/shadow transitions are smooth (~0.35s); fonts and patterns swap instantly
Components use CSS variables (not hardcoded colors) for all themeable properties
All visual theming (colors, borders, radius, shadows, fonts) handled via CSS variables; JS conditionals minimized to non-visual logic only
All existing components have been refactored to read from CSS variables

category: Theme System — Selection Handle Theming & Restructuring
description: Restructure and theme transform/selection handles. Structural changes: resize handles increase from 4 (corners only) to 8 (corners + midpoints). Rotation handles reduce from 4 (all sides) to 1 (top center only, with a visible stem line connecting to the bounding box). Handles scale to 1.3x on hover. Multi-select shows minimal dashed outlines only (not full controls per shape). All handle styling is theme-driven via CSS variables: selection border color/width/dash pattern, handle fill/stroke colors, handle size (7-10px), handle shape (borderRadius — circular for themes A/C, square for theme D, barely rounded for theme B), rotation handle/stem color, hover fill. E.g., Theme B uses dashed selection borders; Theme D uses thick solid borders with square handles; Theme A uses rounded handles with accent colors.
